abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The iOS & iPadOS 14.5 SDK provides support to develop apps for iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch devices running iOS & iPadOS 14.5. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 12.5, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 12.5, see
Many SF Symbols now have default accessibility labels. (70305995)

iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro, and iPhone 11 Pro Max battery health reporting system will recalibrate maximum battery capacity and peak performance capability to address inaccurate estimates of battery health reporting for some users. For more information, see
Using
in a subclass of a type conforming to
now correctly publishes changes. (71816443)
iOS & iPadOS 14.5 includes an optimization to reduce the appearance of a dim glow that might appear at reduced brightness levels with black backgrounds.

iPad (8th generation),  iPad Air (4th generation), iPad Pro 11-inch (2nd generation), and iPad Pro 12.9-inch (4th generation) now mute the built-in microphone when its Smart Folio is closed. To avoid unnecessarily recording the muted signal, the default behavior is to interrupt an audio session that is using the built-in microphone when the Smart Folio is closed. You can opt out of the playback interruption when the Smart Folio is closed by using the new
, allowing the audio session to continue playing uninterrupted while microphone input remains muted. For more information, see
For Music, Podcasts, and Audiobooks requests, updated dialogs for app selection are now available. To ensure your app is set up to participate in Siri app selection, see
With view-through attribution,
now supports all ad formats for promoting apps. (70345857)
You’re now able to use either version 1.0 or version 2.0 signatures when generated using iOS & iPadOS 14.5 and later. (71474331)
Added
, a new style for

views that shows both the title and icon of the label using a system-standard layout. In most cases, labels show both title and icon by default. However, some containers might apply a different default label style to their content, such as only showing icons within toolbars on macOS and iOS. To opt in to showing both the title and the icon, apply the title and icon label style:
Types conforming to any style protocol, such as
or

, are now enforced to be value types. Styles must be structures or enumerations, not classes, and conforming a class to a style protocol may trigger an assertion. This is the same restriction that the system has always enforced on types conforming to
You can now apply multiple
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/anyview/sheet(ispresented:ondismiss:content:)
and
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/anyview/fullscreencover(item:ondismiss:content:)
modifiers in the same view hierarchy. (74246633)
Drop locations are now accurate when using
The
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/ellipse/keyboardshortcut(_:)-1xmih
modifier now works in UIKit lifecycle apps. (73792634)
Changes to pages that you provide to a
with
are now correctly reflected in the view. (65701336)
The dismissal animation of a popover modifier when running in a compact horizontal size class now renders as expected. (52606403)
Setting
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/text/preferredcolorscheme(_:)
to
now correctly resets to the system’s preferred color scheme. (67000774)
push and pop now correctly respects disabled animations. (70062477)
no longer causes a ghosting effect, especially over Text. (71344349)
Using the pointer on iPadOS no longer confuses certain gestures. (71344436)
is now recognized as expected in a stack. (71344436)
The destination of
that only differs by local state now resets that state when switching between links as expected. (72117345)
Dynamic properties such as
, and others now work correctly in
instances. (62886135)
property wrappers now work as expected when contained inside an
, causing the system to emit the
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/combine/observableobject/objectwillchange-2oa5v
publisher. (65562845)
instances initialized with a
object now correctly track updates to the
object from background threads, and no longer issue a “not allowed” console warning. (69999449)
Using
without specifying an anchor now scrolls the
the minimum amount to make it visible. (70184639)
A
with
now correctly invokes
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/anyview/onappear(perform:)
and
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/anyview/ondisappear(perform:)
for its tabs. (71225006)
now resolves as an in-line section if applied to a
within a
on iOS, watchOS, and tvOS, using a checkmark to indicate the selected option. (71383311)
Apps and websites can now receive privacy-preserving attributions for ad clicks which navigate users to websites. (70502338)
Don’t use the iOS
information property list key to declare the minimum release of macOS in which your app runs. Use
Future releases of macOS ignore the
key in Mac apps, including apps built with Mac Catalyst.
Future releases of macOS use the
key in iOS apps built with Xcode 12.5 or later. If an iOS app doesn’t include an
key, future releases of macOS compare the app’s
with the version of its Mac Catalyst runtime to determine compatibility.

abstract.text: Constants that specify optional audio behaviors.
An option that indicates whether the system interrupts the audio session when it mutes the built-in microphone.
Observe audio session notifications to ensure that your app responds appropriately to interruptions.
The minimum version of the operating system required for the app to run in macOS.
The minimum version of the operating system required for the app to run in iOS, iPadOS, tvOS, and watchOS.
A type of object with a publisher that emits before the object has changed.
A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
Fine-tune voice controls and improve Siri Suggestions by sharing app capabilities, customized names, and listening habits with the system.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Improving Siri Media Interactions and App Selection

abstract.text: A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.
A property wrapper type that reflects a value from `UserDefaults` and invalidates a view on a change in value in that user default.
A type that applies standard interaction behavior and a custom appearance to all buttons within a view hierarchy.
A property wrapper that reads a value from a view’s environment.
An effect applied when the pointer hovers over a view.
A `PickerStyle` where each option is displayed inline with other views in the current container.
A standard label for user interface items, consisting of an icon with a title.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column, optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
A view that controls a navigation presentation.
A view for presenting a stack of views that represents a visible path in a navigation hierarchy.
A `TabViewStyle` that displays a paged scrolling `TabView`.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A view that shows the progress toward completion of a task.
Scans all scroll views contained by the proxy for the first with a child view with identifier `id`, and then scrolls to that view.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value managed by SwiftUI.
A view that switches between multiple child views using interactive user interface elements.
A label style that shows both the title and icon of the label using a system-standard layout.
The appearance and behavior of a toggle.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
Defines the destination of a drag and drop operation using behavior controlled by the delegate that you provide.
Adds an action to perform when the user moves the pointer over or away from the view’s frame.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
An object that conveys ongoing progress to the user for a specified task.
